snippet: The results, as well as second-quarter forecasts, fell short of Wall Street’s expectations, causing shares to fall a few points in after-hours trading.
abstract: EBay reports first-quarter net income of $677 million, or 51 cents a share, up 19 percent from year-ago quarter; revenue rose 14 percent to $3.7 billion; results fall short of Wall Street expectations, causing shares to fall several points.
lead_paragraph: The results, as well as second-quarter forecasts, fell short of Wall Street’s expectations, causing shares to fall a few points in after-hours trading.

headline.seo: EBay Posts Gains, but Results Miss Estimates
headline.main: EBay’s Profit Rises 19%, but Results Miss Estimates
headline.print_headline: EBay’s Profit Rises 19%, But Results Miss Estimates
